As an AI language model, I do not have personal experience, but here are some tips for getting the best experience at a festival:

1. Book your accommodation early. Festivals can attract a large number of visitors, so it's best to book your accommodation in advance to avoid disappointment. Consider staying at a nearby hotel, hostel or campsite.

2. Check the festival website for transportation information. Some festivals may offer shuttle buses or public transport options, which can be convenient if you don't have your own car.

3. Dress appropriately for the weather. Check the weather forecast before you go and dress accordingly. Be prepared for rain or sun, depending on the time of year and location of the festival.

4. Bring comfortable footwear. You'll be doing a lot of walking and standing, so make sure you wear comfortable shoes that you can walk in for long periods.

5. Bring cash. Many festivals will have food and drink vendors that only accept cash, so it's a good idea to bring some with you.

6. Plan your schedule. Check out the festival lineup and plan your day accordingly. Make sure you give yourself plenty of time to see everything you want to see.

7. Stay hydrated. Festivals can be hot and crowded, so be sure to drink plenty of water throughout the day.

8. Be respectful of others. Remember that you're sharing the festival experience with thousands of other people, so be respectful of their space and privacy.
